entry.title: Some Loci of Rational Cubic Fourfolds
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate the geography of some codimension two loci inside the moduli space of smooth cubic hypersurfaces in $\mathbb P^5$ and the rationality of their elements. In particular, we study the loci of cubics which contain a plane and another surface, whose ideal is generated by quadratic equations. This is the case of cubic and quartic scrolls and Veronese surfaces and some of their degenerations. Using the fact that all degenerations of quartic scrolls in $\mathbb P^5$ contained in a smooth cubic hypersurface are surfaces with one apparent double point, we also show that every cubic hypersurface belonging to the divisor $\mathcal C_{14}$ in the moduli space of smooth cubics is rational. As an application of our results and of the construction of some explicit examples contained in the Appendix, we also prove that the Pfaffian locus is not open in $\mathcal C_{14}$.
